issue.title: Issue with event message containing json being truncated in unusual way
issue.body:
I'm using Seq first time and so far loving it but I noticed something strange when testing including error as json in event message.
I'm not sure if issue comes from Seq or maybe Serilog/.Net.

I know that in Seq event message is truncated to fit window, and whole message is shown when event is expanded.

This is not the case for event message that contain json. For some reason it is truncated to some hardcoded lenght (actually I think lenght range to truncate on word boundry, because I noticed different messages being truncated to slightly different lenghts but always at word boundary).

Logging error as json:
```cs
_logger.LogError("Request {Request} failed with error: {@Error}", requestName, result.Error);
```

Affected event vs 'normally truncated' event (wide browser window):
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b76e0fb-1186-413c-aa25-8f381199fc55)

Truncation does not expand after clicking event (wide browser window):
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/724cd3a0-f849-4935-8936-826744fdd6c0)

Same thing in narrow browser window - notice double truncation:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fee7fdb7-1a53-4a7e-b686-00979d958dad)

comment.body:
Hi! Thanks for dropping us a line.

On the Seq side, this is by design, since in practice many serialized objects end up so large that they push other properties and text included in the message off the screen.

When you expand the event, you should be able to find the complete `Error` property in the property list.

Error: You are using `require('../modules/Game.class.js')` to import the Game class, which is CommonJS syntax. Since your HTML uses `<script type="module">`, you must use ES module syntax: `import Game from '../modules/Game.class.js';`. This is necessary for the script to work in the browser.

comment.body: Potential Issue: You are using `module.exports = Game;`, which is a CommonJS export. If your project is using ES modules (as suggested by the use of `type="module"` in your HTML), you should use `export default Game;` instead. Mixing module systems can lead to import errors.

issue.title: [Request] motd additions
issue.body:
- thirdpersonzoom=[max] - sets max amount the third person camera can zoom out 
(regardless of fly being enabled/disabled)
- -/+forcethirdperson - forces third person to be used
- verspeed=[speed] - sets base vertical speed users move at
- gravity=[number] - sets speed users are accelerated down at

comment.body:
> I would like to make some additions
> 
> * -plugins - Disables ALL plugins
> * allowplugins=abc,abc - Only allows plugins in the list

plugins are loaded when the game starts and are unloaded when the game stops, these are impossible to implement

Issue: The script tag references 'scripts/main.js', but based on your project structure, the correct path might be './src/scripts/main.js' or similar. Please check that the path matches the actual location of your main.js file to avoid a 404 error when loading the script.

repo.description: JS Advanced task. Create a 2048 game.

review.body:
### Review Summary

Thank you for your hard work! Before your project can be approved, there are a few critical issues that need to be addressed to ensure your 2048 game runs correctly in the browser. Most importantly, your code mixes CommonJS (`require`, `module.exports`) and ES module (`import`, `export`) syntax. Since your HTML uses `<script type="module">`, you must use ES module syntax throughout your JavaScript files—otherwise, the game will not load or function in the browser. Additionally, please double-check that the script path in your HTML matches the actual location of your `main.js` file to avoid loading errors. Once you fix these issues, your project should work as expected! Minor issues like the unused `slideRow` method can be cleaned up for better maintainability, but they do not block approval. Keep going—you're almost there! 🚀

***

✨ Please rate this review in the Platform's notification center[^1]. I will be grateful for your feedback! ✨

[^1]: [Rate AI review example](https://snipboard.io/gD6XKF.jpg)

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Fix the issues, commit the changes, and then re-request my review using the **`Re-request review` button**[^2] in the Reviewers tab.

[^2]: [Re-request AI review example](https://snipboard.io/nOXxHN.jpg)

> [!TIP]
> If you have any comments about this review, please leave a message in the [Add a comment](#new_comment_field) section below and **mention me with the `@mateacademy-ai-mentor` tag**[^3].
> I will read your message during my next review of your pull request. Please do not reply directly to my comments, as that feature is not supported yet.

[^3]: [Add AI review comments example](https://snipboard.io/hVlOey.jpg)

> [!CAUTION]
> Do not close the pull request until the review is complete. Closing it early can lead to unexpected behavior and disrupt the review process.

pull_request.title: Chore: bump lint-staged from 13.2.2 to 15.5.2
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 13.2.2 to 15.5.2.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v15.5.2

Patch Changes

  • #1544 5561321 Thanks @​YimingIsCOLD! - Correctly handle colon (:) characters in staged filenames.

v15.5.1

Patch Changes

  • #1533 5d53534 Thanks @​iiroj! - Improve listing of staged files so that lint-staged doesn't crash when encountering an uninitialized submodule. This should result in less errors like:

    ✖ Failed to get staged files!

v15.5.0

Minor Changes

  • #1526 630af5f Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged no longer resets to the original state when preventing an empty git commit. This happens when your configured tasks reset all the staged changes, typically when trying to commit formatting changes which conflict with your linter setup like ESLint or Prettier.

    Example with Prettier

    By default Prettier prefers double quotes.

    Previously

    1. Stage file.js with only double quotes " changed to '
    2. Run git commit -am "I don't like double quotes"
    3. Lint-staged runs prettier --write file.js, converting all the ' back to "
    4. Because there are now no changes, lint-staged fails, cancels the commit, and resets back to the original state
    5. Commit was not done, original state is restored and single quotes ' are staged

    Now

    1. Stage file.js with only double-quotes " changed to '
    2. Run git commit -am "I don't like double quotes"
    3. Lint-staged runs prettier --write file.js, converting all the ' back to "
    4. Because there are now no changes, lint-staged fails and cancels the commit
    5. Commit was not done, and there are no staged changes

v15.4.3

Patch Changes

  • #1512 cbfed1d Thanks @​tarik02! - Adjust TypeScript types for the default export so that it can be used as a value without error TS2693.

v15.4.2

Patch Changes

  • #1509 8827ebf Thanks @​iiroj! - Change lint-staged's dependencies to use caret (^) ranges instead of tilde (~). This makes it easier for package managers to perform dependency management when minor-level updates are also permitted instead of just patch-level.

v15.4.1

Patch Changes

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

15.5.2

Patch Changes

  • #1544 5561321 Thanks @​YimingIsCOLD! - Correctly handle colon (:) characters in staged filenames.

15.5.1

Patch Changes

  • #1533 5d53534 Thanks @​iiroj! - Improve listing of staged files so that lint-staged doesn't crash when encountering an uninitialized submodule. This should result in less errors like:

    ✖ Failed to get staged files!

15.5.0

Minor Changes

  • #1526 630af5f Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged no longer resets to the original state when preventing an empty git commit. This happens when your configured tasks reset all the staged changes, typically when trying to commit formatting changes which conflict with your linter setup like ESLint or Prettier.

    Example with Prettier

    By default Prettier prefers double quotes.

    Previously

    1. Stage file.js with only double quotes " changed to '
    2. Run git commit -am "I don't like double quotes"
    3. Lint-staged runs prettier --write file.js, converting all the ' back to "
    4. Because there are now no changes, lint-staged fails, cancels the commit, and resets back to the original state
    5. Commit was not done, original state is restored and single quotes ' are staged

    Now

    1. Stage file.js with only double-quotes " changed to '
    2. Run git commit -am "I don't like double quotes"
    3. Lint-staged runs prettier --write file.js, converting all the ' back to "
    4. Because there are now no changes, lint-staged fails and cancels the commit
    5. Commit was not done, and there are no staged changes

15.4.3

Patch Changes

  • #1512 cbfed1d Thanks @​tarik02! - Adjust TypeScript types for the default export so that it can be used as a value without error TS2693.

15.4.2

... (truncated)

  • 64148fd Merge pull request #1545 from lint-staged/revert-v16-changes

  • 9e17c9c Revert "chore: remove validation of deprecated advanced config options"
  • 6fda79a Revert "feat: remove --shell flag support"
  • e1ea676 Revert "feat: replace execa with nano-spawn"

  • 2fa909d feat: remove --shell flag support
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 13.2.2 to 15.5.2.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v15.5.2

Patch Changes

  • #1544 5561321 Thanks @​YimingIsCOLD! - Correctly handle colon (:) characters in staged filenames.

v15.5.1

Patch Changes

  • #1533 5d53534 Thanks @​iiroj! - Improve listing of staged files so that lint-staged doesn't crash when encountering an uninitialized submodule. This should result in less errors like:

    ✖ Failed to get staged files!

v15.5.0

Minor Changes

  • #1526 630af5f Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged no longer resets to the original state when preventing an empty git commit. This happens when your configured tasks reset all the staged changes, typically when trying to commit formatting changes which conflict with your linter setup like ESLint or Prettier.

    Example with Prettier

    By default Prettier prefers double quotes.

    Previously

    1. Stage file.js with only double quotes " changed to '
    2. Run git commit -am "I don't like double quotes"
    3. Lint-staged runs prettier --write file.js, converting all the ' back to "
    4. Because there are now no changes, lint-staged fails, cancels the commit, and resets back to the original state
    5. Commit was not done, original state is restored and single quotes ' are staged

    Now

    1. Stage file.js with only double-quotes " changed to '
    2. Run git commit -am "I don't like double quotes"
    3. Lint-staged runs prettier --write file.js, converting all the ' back to "
    4. Because there are now no changes, lint-staged fails and cancels the commit
    5. Commit was not done, and there are no staged changes

-----|--------------------

Summary | SingleM is a tool for profiling shotgun metagenomes. It has a particular strength in detecting microbial lineages which are not in reference databases. The method it uses also makes it suitable for some related tasks, such as assessing eukaryotic contamination, finding bias in genome recovery, and lineage-targeted MAG recovery.

commits.message: Fix: restore working CrimznBot with GPT-4o + live prices

pull_request.title: Add system alerts to navbar
pull_request.body:
## Summary
- Add a system alerts functionality to the navbar that displays context-sensitive messages
- Implemented "Contribute Data" alert encouraging users to contribute node data to Xatu
- Alert appears on all beacon chain routes to drive traffic to the Google Form
- Responsive design: full alert on XL screens, compact button on smaller screens

## Implementation Details
- Created a new SystemAlert component that can be used for different alerts
- Integrated with the navigation bar in a central position
- Alert visibility is route-based, currently targeting /beacon routes
- Mobile optimized with responsive hiding of elements

## Test plan
- Verify alert displays correctly on beacon routes
- Confirm alert is responsive (adapts to screen size)
- Ensure alert doesn't display on non-beacon routes
- Test Google Form link opens correctly

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

issue.title: readme steps
issue.body:
I followed the steps in the [readme.md](https://github.com/pat-jj/KARE/blob/main/readme.md), but is the following section necessary?
It seems that the files pubmed_data.db, pmids_test.dat, embeddings_test.dat, and pubmed_embeddings.h5 are not used in the subsequent steps.

----

Extract KG from PubMed:

Preparation:

```python
cd kg_construct/pubmed_index
python download_pubmed.py
python embed_pubmed.py
python convert_dat.py
```
